SENT.plain: This report describes a case of a delayed cerebral embolic infarction, after internal carotid artery (ICA) ligation secondary to carotid body tumor resection
We describe a 34-year-old woman who underwent left ICA ligation during a large carotid body tumor surgery
Immediately after surgery, the patient was neurologically asymptomatic; however, she subsequently developed a cerebral embolic infarction nine hours postoperatively
After beginning antiplatelet therapy, all symptoms ultimately resolved, although over a gradual course
Since the ligation of the ICA can cause thromboembolic infarctions of the cerebrum, we contend that antiplatelet agents be administered to prevent and/or treat embolic strokes
